New Records: Sean Manaea pitched a gem, allowing three runs on three hits with six strikeouts and an ERA of 2.50 in seven-plus innings.
Francisco Alvarez hit a clutch two-run double in the seventh inning.
Luisangel Acuna homered again, extending his streak with a solo shot in the second inning.
Key Match Events: A seventh-inning rally led by Francisco Alvarez with a two-run double decided the game.
Luisangel Acuna's solo home run in the second inning gave the Mets an early lead.
Sean Manaea's dominant pitching performance kept the Phillies off the board until the eighth inning.
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets played with the atmosphere of a playoff team, with a large crowd supporting them.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Carlos Mendoza highlighted the win as a pivotal moment in their playoff push.
Players expressed excitement and pride in the team's resilience and performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game's significance in the playoff race kept the Mets in a strong position.
The large crowd at Citi Field matched the intensity of a postseason game.
